page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: Most of the Fells in the area are in the NNE part.They rise to a height of 271m.As we looked down from them most of the fields in the valley were intensively managed grassland but when we looked to the W we could see Caldbeck fells,while in the N we saw England's tallest chimney which is 13 miles away at Carlisle.To the SE we could see the Pennines and to the SW,Blencathra 868m.high. Nearly all the houses lie in the valley.They are made of pink sandstone quarried from the hills on which we were standing. The Farm houses in the area are Low Street,Fair Bank,Wood Head,Forest Hill,Mounsey Bank,Holme Head,Low House ,Plumpton Head,Boggle Hall,West View, Stoney Beck,Bowscar,Nelson Hill and Plumpton Old Hall.
